title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: # Exact match location = /path { # Matches /path exactly } # Prefix match location /images/ { # Matches /images/* } # Regex match (case-sensitive) location ~ \.php$ { # Matches .php files } # Regex match (case-insensitive) location ~* \.(jpg|png|gif)$ { # Matches image files } # Priority prefix match location ^~ /static/ { # Stops regex matching }

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: location / { proxy_pass http://localhost:3000; proxy_http_version 1.1; # Headers proxy_set_header Host $host; proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme; # WebSocket support proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade; proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade" ; # Timeouts proxy_connect_timeout 60s; proxy_send_timeout 60s; proxy_read_timeout 60s; }

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: upstream backend { # Round-robin (default) server backend1.example.com; server backend2.example.com; server backend3.example.com; } upstream weighted { # Weighted distribution server backend1.example.com weight=3; server backend2.example.com weight=1; } upstream ip_hash_backend { # Session persistence ip_hash ; server backend1.example.com; server backend2.example.com; } upstream least_conn_backend { # Least connections least_conn ; server backend1.example.com; server backend2.example.com; }

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: server { listen 443 ssl http2; listen [::]:443 ssl http2; server_name example.com; # SSL certificates ssl_certificate /path/to/cert.pem; ssl_certificate_key /path/to/key.pem; # SSL protocols and ciphers ssl_protocols TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3; ssl_ciphers HIGH:!aNULL:!MD5; ssl_prefer_server_ciphers on; # SSL session cache ssl_session_cache shared:SSL:10m; ssl_session_timeout 10m; # HSTS add_header Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000" always; } # HTTP to HTTPS redirect server { listen 80; server_name example.com; return 301 https://$server_name$request_uri; }

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: location /static/ { alias /var/www/static/; expires 30d; add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable" ; } location ~* \.(jpg|jpeg|png|gif|ico|css|js)$ { expires 1y; add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable" ; access_log off; } # Gzip compression gzip on; gzip_vary on; gzip_types text/plain text/css application/json application/javascript text/xml; gzip_min_length 1000;

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: # Add security headers add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN" always; add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff" always; add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block" always; add_header Referrer-Policy "no-referrer-when-downgrade" always; add_header Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'" always; # Hide Nginx version server_tokens off; # Limit request size client_max_body_size 10M; # Rate limiting limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=mylimit:10m rate=10r/s; limit_req zone=mylimit burst=20 nodelay;

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: # Permanent redirect return 301 https://example.com$request_uri; # Temporary redirect return 302 /new-location; # Rewrite URL rewrite ^/old-path/(.*)$ /new-path/$1 permanent; # Conditional redirect if ($host != "example.com" ) { return 301 https://example.com$request_uri; } # Try files in order try_files $uri $uri/ /index.html;

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: location ~ \.php$ { fastcgi_pass unix:/var/run/php/php8.1-fpm.sock; fastcgi_index index.php; fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $document_root$fastcgi_script_name; include fastcgi_params; # Security: prevent access to hidden files fastcgi_param PHP_VALUE "open_basedir=$document_root:/tmp/" ; } # Deny access to .php files in uploads location ~* /uploads/.*\.php$ { deny all; }

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: # Custom log format log_format main '$remote_addr - $remote_user [$time_local] ' '"$request" $status $body_bytes_sent ' '"$http_referer" "$http_user_agent"' ; # JSON log format log_format json escape=json '{' '"time":"$time_iso8601",' '"remote_addr":"$remote_addr",' '"request":"$request",' '"status":$status,' '"body_bytes_sent":$body_bytes_sent' '}' ; access_log /var/log/nginx/access.log main; error_log /var/log/nginx/error.log warn;

title: ⚙️ Nginx Configuration
content: server { listen 80; server_name app.example.com; root /var/www/app/dist; index index.html; # Handle client-side routing location / { try_files $uri $uri/ /index.html; } # Cache static assets location ~* \.(js|css|png|jpg|jpeg|gif|ico|svg)$ { expires 1y; add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable" ; } # API proxy location /api/ { proxy_pass http://localhost:3000/; proxy_set_header Host $host; proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr; } }

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: // Fibonacci with memoization function fib(n, memo = {}): // Base cases if n <= 1: return n // Check if already computed if n in memo: return memo[n] // Compute and store memo[n] = fib(n - 1, memo) + fib(n - 2, memo) return memo[n]

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: // Fibonacci with tabulation function fib(n): if n <= 1: return n // Create table dp = array [n + 1] // Base cases dp[0] = 0 dp[1] = 1 // Fill table bottom-up for i = 2 to n: dp[i] = dp[i - 1] + dp[i - 2] return dp[n]

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: // Problem: Max value with weight limit function knapsack(weights, values, capacity): n = length(weights) dp = array [n + 1][capacity + 1] // Base case: 0 items or 0 capacity = 0 value for i = 0 to n: dp[i][0] = 0 for w = 0 to capacity: dp[0][w] = 0 // Fill table for i = 1 to n: for w = 1 to capacity: if weights[i - 1] <= w: // Max of: include item or exclude item include = values[i - 1] + dp[i - 1][w - weights[i - 1]] exclude = dp[i - 1][w] dp[i][w] = max(include, exclude) else : // Can't include, too heavy dp[i][w] = dp[i - 1][w] return dp[n][capacity]

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: // Find longest common subsequence function lcs(text1, text2): m = length(text1) n = length(text2) dp = array [m + 1][n + 1] // Base case: empty string has LCS of 0 for i = 0 to m: dp[i][0] = 0 for j = 0 to n: dp[0][j] = 0 // Fill table for i = 1 to m: for j = 1 to n: if text1[i - 1] == text2[j - 1]: // Characters match, extend LCS dp[i][j] = 1 + dp[i - 1][j - 1] else : // Take max from excluding one char dp[i][j] = max(dp[i - 1][j], dp[i][j - 1]) return dp[m][n]

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: // DP approach O(n²) function lengthOfLIS(nums): n = length(nums) if n == 0: return 0 // dp[i] = length of LIS ending at index i dp = array [n] filled with 1 for i = 1 to n - 1: for j = 0 to i - 1: if nums[j] < nums[i]: // Can extend LIS ending at j dp[i] = max(dp[i], dp[j] + 1) return max(dp) // Binary search approach O(n log n) function lengthOfLIS_Optimized(nums): tails = [] // tails[i] = smallest tail of LIS of length i+1 for num in nums: // Binary search for position pos = binarySearch(tails, num) if pos == length(tails): tails.append(num) else : tails[pos] = num return length(tails)

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: // Coin change: min coins to make amount function coinChange(coins, amount): dp = array [amount + 1] filled with infinity dp[0] = 0 // Base case: 0 coins for amount 0 for a = 1 to amount: for coin in coins: if a - coin >= 0: // Can use this coin dp[a] = min(dp[a], 1 + dp[a - coin]) return dp[amount] if dp[amount] != infinity else -1 // Coin change: count ways to make amount function coinChangeWays(coins, amount): dp = array [amount + 1] filled with 0 dp[0] = 1 // One way to make 0: use no coins // Iterate coins first to avoid duplicates for coin in coins: for a = coin to amount: dp[a] += dp[a - coin] return dp[amount]

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: // Longest palindromic subsequence function longestPalindromeSubseq(s): n = length(s) dp = array [n][n] // Base case: single character is palindrome for i = 0 to n - 1: dp[i][i] = 1 // Fill table for increasing lengths for length = 2 to n: for i = 0 to n - length: j = i + length - 1 if s[i] == s[j]: // Characters match, add 2 dp[i][j] = 2 + dp[i + 1][j - 1] else : // Take max excluding one end dp[i][j] = max(dp[i + 1][j], dp[i][j - 1]) return dp[0][n - 1] // Longest palindromic substring (expand around center) function longestPalindrome(s): if length(s) < 2: return s start = 0, maxLen = 0 for i = 0 to length(s) - 1: // Odd length palindrome len1 = expandAroundCenter(s, i, i) // Even length palindrome len2 = expandAroundCenter(s, i, i + 1) len = max(len1, len2) if len > maxLen: start = i - (len - 1) / 2 maxLen = len return s[start:start + maxLen]

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: // Best time to buy/sell stock with cooldown function maxProfit(prices): n = length(prices) if n <= 1: return 0 // States: hold stock, sold (cooldown), rest hold = -prices[0] // Bought first stock sold = 0 // Just sold rest = 0 // Resting/can buy for i = 1 to n - 1: prevHold = hold prevSold = sold prevRest = rest // Transitions hold = max(prevHold, prevRest - prices[i]) // Keep or buy sold = prevHold + prices[i] // Sell rest = max(prevRest, prevSold) // Rest return max(sold, rest)

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: Problem Type                    | Pattern              | State Definition --------------------------------|----------------------|--------------------------- Subset selection with limit     | 0/1 Knapsack         | dp[i][w] = max value Unlimited item usage            | Unbounded Knapsack   | dp[amount] = min/max/count Two sequences comparison        | LCS                  | dp[i][j] = LCS length Single sequence optimization    | LIS                  | dp[i] = LIS ending at i Palindrome problems             | Palindrome DP        | dp[i][j] = palindrome [i,j] State-based decisions           | State Machine        | dp[i][state] = value Path counting in grid           | Grid DP              | dp[i][j] = paths to (i,j) Partition problems              | Partition DP         | dp[i] = can partition String transformation           | Edit Distance        | dp[i][j] = min operations

title: 💰 Dynamic Programming Patterns
content: Pattern              | Time Complexity | Space Complexity | Space Optimized ---------------------|-----------------|------------------|------------------ 0/1 Knapsack         | O(n × W)        | O(n × W)         | O(W) Unbounded Knapsack   | O(n × W)        | O(W)             | O(W) LCS                  | O(m × n)        | O(m × n)         | O(min(m,n)) LIS (DP)             | O(n²)           | O(n)             | O(n) LIS (Binary Search)  | O(n log n)      | O(n)             | O(n) Palindrome DP        | O(n²)           | O(n²)            | O(n) State Machine        | O(n × states)   | O(n × states)    | O(states) Grid Path            | O(m × n)        | O(m × n)         | O(n)

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Basic select SELECT * FROM users; -- Select specific columns SELECT name, email FROM users; -- With alias SELECT name AS full_name FROM users; -- Distinct values SELECT DISTINCT city FROM users; -- Limit results SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 10;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Basic conditions SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 18; -- Multiple conditions SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 18 AND city = 'NYC'; -- OR condition WHERE city = 'NYC' OR city = 'LA'; -- IN operator WHERE city IN ('NYC', 'LA', 'SF'); -- BETWEEN WHERE age BETWEEN 18 AND 65; -- LIKE pattern matching WHERE name LIKE 'J%'; WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com'; -- IS NULL WHERE phone IS NULL ; WHERE phone IS NOT NULL ;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Sort ascending (default) SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY name; -- Sort descending ORDER BY age DESC ; -- Multiple columns ORDER BY city ASC , age DESC ;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- COUNT SELECT COUNT (*) FROM users; SELECT COUNT ( DISTINCT city) FROM users; -- SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX SELECT SUM (price) FROM orders; SELECT AVG (age) FROM users; SELECT MIN (price), MAX (price) FROM products;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Group by single column SELECT city, COUNT (*) FROM users GROUP BY city; -- Multiple columns SELECT city, age, COUNT (*) FROM users GROUP BY city, age; -- HAVING (filter groups) SELECT city, COUNT (*) AS cnt FROM users GROUP BY city HAVING cnt > 10;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- INNER JOIN SELECT users.name, orders.amount FROM users INNER JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id; -- LEFT JOIN SELECT users.name, orders.amount FROM users LEFT JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id; -- RIGHT JOIN RIGHT JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id; -- FULL OUTER JOIN FULL OUTER JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Insert single row INSERT INTO users (name, email, age) VALUES ('John', 'j@ex.com', 30); -- Insert multiple rows INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES ('Alice', 'a@ex.com'), ('Bob', 'b@ex.com'); -- Insert from select INSERT INTO archive SELECT * FROM users WHERE status = 'inactive';

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Delete specific rows DELETE FROM users WHERE id = 1; -- Delete all rows (careful!) DELETE FROM users; -- Truncate (faster, resets auto-increment) TRUNCATE TABLE users;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: CREATE TABLE users ( id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT , name VARCHAR (100) NOT NULL , email VARCHAR (255) UNIQUE , age INT , created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ); -- With foreign key CREATE TABLE orders ( id INT PRIMARY KEY , user_id INT , amount DECIMAL (10, 2), FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id) );

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Add column ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN phone VARCHAR (20); -- Drop column ALTER TABLE users DROP COLUMN phone; -- Modify column ALTER TABLE users MODIFY COLUMN age SMALLINT ; -- Rename column ALTER TABLE users RENAME COLUMN name TO full_name;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Create index CREATE INDEX idx_email ON users(email); -- Unique index CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_email ON users(email); -- Composite index CREATE INDEX idx_name_city ON users(name, city); -- Drop index DROP INDEX idx_email ON users;

title: 🗄️ SQL Queries & Commands
content: -- Subquery in WHERE SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > ( SELECT AVG (age) FROM users); -- Subquery in FROM SELECT avg_age FROM ( SELECT AVG (age) AS avg_age FROM users) AS subquery; -- Correlated subquery SELECT name FROM users u WHERE age > ( SELECT AVG (age) FROM users u2 WHERE u2.city = u.city);

title: 🎯 Algorithm Patterns
content: // Fixed window size function maxSumSubarray(arr, k): windowSum = sum(arr[0:k]) maxSum = windowSum for i = k to length(arr) - 1: windowSum = windowSum - arr[i - k] + arr[i] maxSum = max(maxSum, windowSum) return maxSum // Variable window size function longestSubstringKDistinct(s, k): left = 0, maxLen = 0 charCount = {} for right = 0 to length(s) - 1: charCount[s[right]]++ while size(charCount) > k: charCount[s[left]]-- if charCount[s[left]] == 0: remove s[left] from charCount left++ maxLen = max(maxLen, right - left + 1) return maxLen

title: 🎯 Algorithm Patterns
content: // Opposite direction (converging) function twoSum(arr, target): left = 0 right = length(arr) - 1 while left < right: sum = arr[left] + arr[right] if sum == target: return [left, right] else if sum < target: left++ else : right-- return null // Same direction (chasing) function removeDuplicates(arr): if length(arr) == 0: return 0 slow = 0 for fast = 1 to length(arr) - 1: if arr[fast] != arr[slow]: slow++ arr[slow] = arr[fast] return slow + 1

title: 🎯 Algorithm Patterns
content: // Cycle detection function hasCycle(head): slow = head fast = head while fast != null and fast.next != null: slow = slow.next fast = fast.next.next if slow == fast: return true return false // Find middle of linked list function findMiddle(head): slow = head fast = head while fast != null and fast.next != null: slow = slow.next fast = fast.next.next return slow // Middle node // Find cycle start function findCycleStart(head): slow = fast = head // Find meeting point while fast and fast.next: slow = slow.next fast = fast.next.next if slow == fast: break // Find cycle start slow = head while slow != fast: slow = slow.next fast = fast.next return slow

title: 🎯 Algorithm Patterns
content: // Merge overlapping intervals function mergeIntervals(intervals): if length(intervals) <= 1: return intervals // Sort by start time sort(intervals, key=start) merged = [intervals[0]] for i = 1 to length(intervals) - 1: current = intervals[i] last = merged[length(merged) - 1] if current.start <= last.end: // Overlapping, merge them last.end = max(last.end, current.end) else : // Non-overlapping, add to result merged.append(current) return merged // Insert interval function insertInterval(intervals, newInterval): result = [] i = 0 // Add all intervals before newInterval while i < length(intervals) and intervals[i].end < newInterval.start: result.append(intervals[i]) i++ // Merge overlapping intervals while i < length(intervals) and intervals[i].start <= newInterval.end: newInterval.start = min(newInterval.start, intervals[i].start) newInterval.end = max(newInterval.end, intervals[i].end) i++ result.append(newInterval) // Add remaining intervals while i < length(intervals): result.append(intervals[i]) i++ return result

title: 🎯 Algorithm Patterns
content: // Cyclic sort - place each number at its correct index function cyclicSort(arr): i = 0 while i < length(arr): correctIndex = arr[i] - 1 if arr[i] != arr[correctIndex]: swap(arr[i], arr[correctIndex]) else : i++ return arr // Find missing number function findMissingNumber(arr): i = 0 n = length(arr) // Place each number at index equal to its value while i < n: correctIndex = arr[i] if arr[i] < n and arr[i] != arr[correctIndex]: swap(arr[i], arr[correctIndex]) else : i++ // Find the first index where number doesn't match for i = 0 to n - 1: if arr[i] != i: return i return n // Find all duplicates function findDuplicates(arr): i = 0 while i < length(arr): correctIndex = arr[i] - 1 if arr[i] != arr[correctIndex]: swap(arr[i], arr[correctIndex]) else : i++ duplicates = [] for i = 0 to length(arr) - 1: if arr[i] != i + 1: duplicates.append(arr[i]) return duplicates

title: 🎯 Algorithm Patterns
content: // Reverse entire linked list function reverseList(head): prev = null current = head while current != null: next = current.next current.next = prev prev = current current = next return prev // New head // Reverse sublist from position m to n function reverseBetween(head, m, n): if m == n: return head // Skip to position m-1 current = head prev = null for i = 0 to m - 1: prev = current current = current.next // Reverse from m to n lastNodeBeforeReverse = prev lastNodeOfReverse = current for i = 0 to n - m: next = current.next current.next = prev prev = current current = next // Connect with remaining list if lastNodeBeforeReverse != null: lastNodeBeforeReverse.next = prev else : head = prev lastNodeOfReverse.next = current return head // Reverse every k nodes function reverseKGroup(head, k): if k <= 1 or head == null: return head current = head prev = null while true: lastNodeBeforeReverse = prev lastNodeOfReverse = current // Reverse k nodes for i = 0 to k - 1 and current != null: next = current.next current.next = prev prev = current current = next // Connect with previous part if lastNodeBeforeReverse != null: lastNodeBeforeReverse.next = prev else : head = prev lastNodeOfReverse.next = current if current == null: break prev = lastNodeOfReverse return head

title: 🎯 Algorithm Patterns
content: Pattern              | Time       | Space      | Best Use Case ---------------------|------------|------------|-------------------------------- Sliding Window       | O(n)       | O(1)-O(k)  | Contiguous subarrays/substrings Two Pointers         | O(n)       | O(1)       | Sorted arrays, pairs/triplets Fast & Slow Pointers | O(n)       | O(1)       | Linked list cycles, middle Merge Intervals      | O(n log n) | O(n)       | Overlapping intervals Cyclic Sort          | O(n)       | O(1)       | Numbers in range [1, n] In-Place Reversal    | O(n)       | O(1)       | Reversing linked lists

title: Common Algorithms
content: function quicksort(arr, low, high): if low < high: pivot = partition(arr, low, high) quicksort(arr, low, pivot - 1) quicksort(arr, pivot + 1, high) function partition(arr, low, high): pivot = arr[high] i = low - 1 for j = low to high - 1: if arr[j] < pivot: i = i + 1 swap(arr[i], arr[j]) swap(arr[i + 1], arr[high]) return i + 1

title: Common Algorithms
content: function mergesort(arr): if length(arr) <= 1: return arr mid = length(arr) / 2 left = mergesort(arr[0:mid]) right = mergesort(arr[mid:end]) return merge(left, right) function merge(left, right): result = [] while left and right not empty: if left[0] <= right[0]: append left[0] to result else : append right[0] to result append remaining elements return result

title: Common Algorithms
content: function heapsort(arr): n = length(arr) // Build max heap for i = n/2 - 1 down to 0: heapify(arr, n, i) // Extract elements from heap for i = n - 1 down to 1: swap(arr[0], arr[i]) heapify(arr, i, 0) function heapify(arr, n, i): largest = i left = 2 * i + 1 right = 2 * i + 2 if left < n and arr[left] > arr[largest]: largest = left if right < n and arr[right] > arr[largest]: largest = right if largest != i: swap(arr[i], arr[largest]) heapify(arr, n, largest)

title: Common Algorithms
content: // Iterative approach function binarySearch(arr, target): left = 0 right = length(arr) - 1 while left <= right: mid = left + (right - left) / 2 if arr[mid] == target: return mid else if arr[mid] < target: left = mid + 1 else : right = mid - 1 return -1 // Not found

title: Common Algorithms
content: // Recursive approach function dfs(node, visited): if node is null or node in visited: return add node to visited process(node) for each neighbor in node.neighbors: dfs(neighbor, visited) // Iterative with stack function dfsIterative(start): stack = [start] visited = set() while stack not empty: node = stack.pop() if node not in visited: add node to visited process(node) for each neighbor in node.neighbors: stack.push(neighbor)

title: Common Algorithms
content: function bfs(start): queue = [start] visited = set([start]) while queue not empty: node = queue.dequeue() process(node) for each neighbor in node.neighbors: if neighbor not in visited: add neighbor to visited queue.enqueue(neighbor) // With distance tracking function bfsWithDistance(start): queue = [(start, 0)] visited = set([start]) while queue not empty: node, distance = queue.dequeue() process(node, distance) for each neighbor in node.neighbors: if neighbor not in visited: add neighbor to visited queue.enqueue((neighbor, distance + 1))

title: Common Algorithms
content: Algorithm      | Best       | Average    | Worst      | Space  | Stable ---------------|------------|------------|------------|--------|-------- Quicksort      | O(n log n) | O(n log n) | O(n²)      | O(log n)| No Mergesort      | O(n log n) | O(n log n) | O(n log n) | O(n)   | Yes Heapsort       | O(n log n) | O(n log n) | O(n log n) | O(1)   | No Bubble Sort    | O(n)       | O(n²)      | O(n²)      | O(1)   | Yes Insertion Sort | O(n)       | O(n²)      | O(n²)      | O(1)   | Yes Selection Sort | O(n²)      | O(n²)      | O(n²)      | O(1)   | No

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Variable declarations var name string = "Alice" var age int = 25 var isActive bool = true // Short declaration (inside functions) count := 42 price := 19.99 // Multiple declarations var ( x int = 10 y int = 20 ) // Constants const Pi = 3.14159 const MaxUsers = 100

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Basic function func add(a int , b int ) int { return a + b } // Multiple return values func divide(a, b int ) ( int , error ) { if b == 0 { return 0, fmt.Errorf( "division by zero" ) } return a / b, nil } // Named return values func split(sum int ) (x, y int ) { x = sum * 4 / 9 y = sum - x return // naked return } // Variadic function func sum(nums ... int ) int { total := 0 for _, num := range nums { total += num } return total }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // If statement (no parentheses needed) if x > 10 { fmt.Println( "x is large" ) } else if x > 5 { fmt.Println( "x is medium" ) } else { fmt.Println( "x is small" ) } // If with initialization if val := compute(); val > 0 { fmt.Println(val) } // Switch switch day { case "Monday" : fmt.Println( "Start of week" ) case "Friday" : fmt.Println( "End of week" ) default : fmt.Println( "Midweek" ) } // Switch without condition (like if-else) switch { case x < 0: fmt.Println( "negative" ) case x == 0: fmt.Println( "zero" ) default : fmt.Println( "positive" ) }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // For loop (only loop in Go) for i := 0; i < 10; i++ { fmt.Println(i) } // While-style loop for count < 100 { count++ } // Infinite loop for { // break to exit } // Range over slice for index, value := range slice { fmt.Println(index, value) } // Range over map for key, value := range myMap { fmt.Println(key, value) } // Ignore index/key with _ for _, value := range slice { fmt.Println(value) }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Arrays (fixed size) var arr [5] int arr[0] = 1 arr2 := [3] string { "a" , "b" , "c" } // Slices (dynamic arrays) slice := [] int {1, 2, 3} slice = append (slice, 4, 5) slice2 := make ([] int , 5) // length 5 slice3 := make ([] int , 0, 10) // len 0, cap 10 // Maps m := make ( map [ string ] int ) m[ "age" ] = 25 value, exists := m[ "age" ] // check existence delete (m, "age" ) // delete key // Map literal scores := map [ string ] int { "Alice" : 90, "Bob" :   85, }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Define struct type Person struct { Name string Age int } // Create instance p1 := Person{Name: "Alice" , Age: 25} p2 := Person{ "Bob" , 30} // Pointer to struct p3 := &Person{ "Charlie" , 35} p3.Age = 36 // auto-dereference // Method on struct func (p Person) Greet() string { return "Hello, " + p.Name } // Pointer receiver (can modify) func (p *Person) Birthday() { p.Age++ }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Define interface type Shape interface { Area() float64 Perimeter() float64 } // Implement interface (implicit) type Rectangle struct { Width, Height float64 } func (r Rectangle) Area() float64 { return r.Width * r.Height } func (r Rectangle) Perimeter() float64 { return 2 * (r.Width + r.Height) } // Empty interface (any type) var anything interface {} anything = 42 anything = "hello" // Type assertion str, ok := anything.( string ) if ok { fmt.Println(str) } // Type switch switch v := anything.( type ) { case int : fmt.Println( "int:" , v) case string : fmt.Println( "string:" , v) }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Functions return errors func readFile(path string ) ([] byte , error ) { data, err := os.ReadFile(path) if err != nil { return nil , err } return data, nil } // Create custom error import "errors" err := errors.New( "something went wrong" ) // Formatted error err := fmt.Errorf( "failed to open %s: %w" , path, err) // Custom error type type MyError struct { Code int Message string } func (e *MyError) Error() string { return fmt.Sprintf( "error %d: %s" , e.Code, e.Message) } // Check error type if errors.Is(err, os.ErrNotExist) { fmt.Println( "file not found" ) }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Start goroutine with go keyword go doSomething() // Anonymous goroutine go func () { fmt.Println( "Running in goroutine" ) }() // Goroutine with parameters go func (msg string ) { fmt.Println(msg) }( "Hello from goroutine" ) // Wait for goroutines with WaitGroup var wg sync.WaitGroup for i := 0; i < 5; i++ { wg.Add(1) go func (id int ) { defer wg.Done() fmt.Println( "Worker" , id) }(i) } wg.Wait() // Wait for all goroutines

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Create channel ch := make ( chan int ) // Send to channel ch <- 42 // Receive from channel value := <-ch // Buffered channel ch := make ( chan int , 10) // buffer size 10 // Close channel close (ch) // Check if channel is closed value, ok := <-ch if !ok { fmt.Println( "Channel closed" ) } // Range over channel for value := range ch { fmt.Println(value) } // Directional channels func send(ch chan <- int ) { // send-only ch <- 42 } func receive(ch <- chan int ) { // receive-only value := <-ch }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Select waits on multiple channels select { case msg1 := <-ch1: fmt.Println( "Received from ch1:" , msg1) case msg2 := <-ch2: fmt.Println( "Received from ch2:" , msg2) case ch3 <- 42: fmt.Println( "Sent to ch3" ) default : fmt.Println( "No channel ready" ) } // Timeout pattern select { case result := <-ch: fmt.Println(result) case <-time.After(5 * time.Second): fmt.Println( "Timeout!" ) } // Non-blocking receive select { case msg := <-ch: fmt.Println(msg) default : fmt.Println( "No message" ) }

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: import "sync" // Mutex for safe concurrent access type SafeCounter struct { mu    sync.Mutex count int } func (c *SafeCounter) Inc() { c.mu.Lock() defer c.mu.Unlock() c.count++ } func (c *SafeCounter) Value() int { c.mu.Lock() defer c.mu.Unlock() return c.count } // RWMutex for read-heavy workloads var rwMutex sync.RWMutex // Multiple readers allowed rwMutex.RLock() defer rwMutex.RUnlock() // Exclusive writer rwMutex.Lock() defer rwMutex.Unlock()

title: 🐹 Go Language
content: // Worker Pool Pattern func worker(id int , jobs <- chan int , results chan <- int ) { for job := range jobs { results <- job * 2 } } jobs := make ( chan int , 100) results := make ( chan int , 100) // Start workers for w := 1; w <= 3; w++ { go worker(w, jobs, results) } // Pipeline Pattern func gen(nums ... int ) <- chan int { out := make ( chan int ) go func () { for _, n := range nums { out <- n } close (out) }() return out } func square(in <- chan int ) <- chan int { out := make ( chan int ) go func () { for n := range in { out <- n * n } close (out) }() return out }

content: // File: math_test.go package math import "testing" func TestAdd(t *testing.T) { result := Add(2, 3) if result != 5 { t.Errorf( "Expected 5, got %d" , result) } } // Table-driven tests func TestAddTable(t *testing.T) { tests := [] struct { a, b, want int }{ {1, 2, 3}, {0, 0, 0}, {-1, 1, 0}, } for _, tt := range tests { got := Add(tt.a, tt.b) if got != tt.want { t.Errorf( "Add(%d, %d) = %d; want %d" , tt.a, tt.b, got, tt.want) } } } // Benchmark func BenchmarkAdd(b *testing.B) { for i := 0; i < b.N; i++ { Add(2, 3) } }

title: 🗄️ Database Design Patterns
content: 1. Identify Entities List all nouns in requirements (User, Order, Product) 2. Define Relationships Determine cardinality (1:1, 1:N, M:N) 3. Identify Attributes List properties for each entity 4. Choose Primary Keys Select appropriate key strategy 5. Normalize to 3NF Eliminate redundancy and dependencies 6. Add Constraints Foreign keys, unique, not null, check constraints 7. Plan Indexes Index foreign keys and query columns 8. Consider Denormalization Optimize for read-heavy patterns if needed 9. Review and Test Validate with sample queries and data

title: 🗄️ Database Design Patterns
content: ✓ Index foreign keys and WHERE/JOIN columns ✓ Use EXPLAIN to analyze slow queries ✓ Avoid SELECT * in production code ✓ Use appropriate data types (smallest that fits) ✓ Implement pagination for large result sets ✓ Use connection pooling ✓ Cache frequently accessed data ✓ Batch INSERT/UPDATE operations ✓ Monitor and remove unused indexes ✓ Consider read replicas for read-heavy workloads ✓ Partition very large tables (>100GB) ✓ Use covering indexes for common queries ✓ Avoid N+1 query problems ✓ Set appropriate timeout values ✓ Regular VACUUM/ANALYZE (PostgreSQL) or OPTIMIZE (MySQL)

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: // Recursive approach function dfs(graph, node, visited): if node in visited: return add node to visited process(node) for each neighbor in graph[node]: dfs(graph, neighbor, visited)

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: function bfs(graph, start): queue = [start] visited = set([start]) while queue not empty: node = queue.dequeue() process(node) for each neighbor in graph[node]: if neighbor not in visited: add neighbor to visited queue.enqueue(neighbor)

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: function dijkstra(graph, start): dist = array of size V, initialized to ∞ dist[start] = 0 pq = min-heap with (0, start) while pq not empty: d, u = pq.extractMin() if d > dist[u]: continue for each (v, weight) in graph[u]: if dist[u] + weight < dist[v]: dist[v] = dist[u] + weight pq.insert((dist[v], v)) return dist

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: function bellmanFord(graph, start, V, E): dist = array of size V, initialized to ∞ dist[start] = 0 // Relax edges V-1 times for i = 1 to V - 1: for each edge (u, v, weight) in E: if dist[u] != ∞ and dist[u] + weight < dist[v]: dist[v] = dist[u] + weight // Check for negative cycles for each edge (u, v, weight) in E: if dist[u] != ∞ and dist[u] + weight < dist[v]: return "Negative cycle detected" return dist

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: function floydWarshall(graph, V): // Initialize distance matrix dist = V × V matrix, initialized to ∞ for i = 0 to V - 1: dist[i][i] = 0 for each edge (u, v, weight): dist[u][v] = weight // Dynamic programming for k = 0 to V - 1: for i = 0 to V - 1: for j = 0 to V - 1: if dist[i][k] + dist[k][j] < dist[i][j]: dist[i][j] = dist[i][k] + dist[k][j] return dist

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: function kruskal(graph, V, E): result = [] // MST edges uf = UnionFind(V) // Sort edges by weight edges = sort(E by weight) for each edge (u, v, weight) in edges: if uf.find(u) != uf.find(v): uf.union(u, v) add edge to result if length(result) == V - 1: break return result

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: function prim(graph, start, V): inMST = array of size V, initialized to false key = array of size V, initialized to ∞ parent = array of size V, initialized to -1 pq = min-heap with (0, start) key[start] = 0 while pq not empty: weight, u = pq.extractMin() if inMST[u]: continue inMST[u] = true for each (v, w) in graph[u]: if not inMST[v] and w < key[v]: key[v] = w parent[v] = u pq.insert((w, v)) return parent // MST structure

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: // DFS-based approach function topologicalSort(graph, V): visited = set() stack = [] function dfs(node): add node to visited for each neighbor in graph[node]: if neighbor not in visited: dfs(neighbor) stack.push(node) for each vertex v in V: if v not in visited: dfs(v) return reverse(stack)

title: 🕸️ Graph Algorithms
content: Algorithm      | Time Complexity    | Space  | Negative Weights | Use Case ---------------|-------------------|--------|------------------|--------------------------- BFS            | O(V + E)          | O(V)   | No               | Unweighted graphs Dijkstra       | O((V+E) log V)    | O(V)   | No               | Non-negative weights Bellman-Ford   | O(V × E)          | O(V)   | Yes              | Negative weights, cycles Floyd-Warshall | O(V³)             | O(V²)  | Yes              | All-pairs shortest path
